data.benefits: The scheme provides working capital term loan assistance of up to Rs. 300 lakhs with flexible repayment terms, including a moratorium of up to 6 months.
data.eligibility: All MSME units who are in operations for minimum 3 years are eligible under this scheme.
data.conditions:
1. Minimum 3 years operations, (2 years for Existing customer of SIDBI). 
  2. Operating profit during past 2 years, (1 year for Existing Customers). 
  3. Repayment period is 3 years. 
  4. Standard Norms apply (CIBIL / CMR, due diligence checks etc. Should not be in default to any bank/FI.
data.beneficiaries: All MSME units who are in operations for minimum 3 years are eligible under this scheme.
data.prerequisites:
1. Minimum 3 years operations, (2 years for Existing customer of SIDBI). Operating profit during past 2 years, (1 year for Existing Customers). 
  2. Repayment period is 3 years. Standard Norms apply (CIBIL / CMR, due diligence checks etc. 
  3. Should not be in default to any bank/FI.
data.nodal_agency: Small Industries Development Bank of India (SIDBI)
data.context: This scheme is introduced to Enhance Production of MSMEs provide term loan to MSMEs.
data.objective: The main aim is to provide medium/short term financial assistance to eligible MSMEs for augmenting NWC and / or to execute urgent confirmed orders.
data.description:
1. Scheme provides Working capital term loan assistance for augmenting net working capital and/or to execute urgent confirmed orders. 
  2. Moratorium period is up to 6 months. 
  3. Financing up to Rs. 300 lakh for existing customers and Rs. 200 lakh for new customers.
data.how_to_apply: The applicants can apply through below portal (https://innovative.msme.gov.in).
data.funding_facilitator: Small Industries Development Bank of India (SIDBI)
data.funding_mechanism: Funds will be disbursed by SIDBI successful sanction and completion of requisite documents.
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Application Form
2. Proforma Invoice of the Machinery (quotation)   
3. KYC documents (as per Bankâ€™s guidelines)  
4. Past three years audited financial statements    
5. Statement of immovable properties of promoter/directors   
6. Copy of Memorandum of Association (MoA)/ Partnership deed/ Trust Deed, etc.  
7. Copy of consent to establish from PCB     
8. Document showing Existing Power load     
9. Application filed for additional power load required (if applicable)  
10. Copy of rent/lease agreement (self-certified)    
11. CIBIL Report  
12. Udyam Registration Certificate (URC)    
13. Copy of GST Registration Certificate (for GST registered units)  
14. Copy of sanction letters of other lenders for existing banking arrangement. 
15. Information of loans provided by other banks, financial institutions, and NBFCs (Non-Banking Financial Companies) that are currently outstanding.
